symptoms.name: Lower urinary tract symptoms (LUTS)
symptoms.pattern: Irritative voiding (common), obstructive (can lead to surgery)

symptoms.name: Asymptomatic
symptoms.pattern: Incidental finding during autopsy, biopsy, or prostatectomy

physical_findings: Enlarged prostate with hard consistency and nodules (suspicious for cancer)
Non-tender, nodular, firm to hard prostate (rarely enlarged)
Prostate abscess (with spontaneous drainage or requiring drainage)

lab_values.PSA: Slightly elevated (mean 8.26-13.24 ng/ml, can be very high)
lab_values.Acid-fast bacilli (AFB) smear: Positive in some cases (variable positivity rate)
lab_values.Mycobacterium tuberculosis culture: Positive in some cases (variable positivity rate)
lab_values.PCR for M. tuberculosis: Highly sensitive and specific (100% positivity in one study)

imaging_findings.Transrectal ultrasonogram (TRUS): Hypoechoic areas with irregular outlines, calcification

required: Histopathological examination showing chronic granulomatous prostatitis with Langhans-type giant cells
supportive: Clinical presentation consistent with tuberculosis of the prostate
